step_feedback.feedback: For step 1, focus on keeping your wrists closer to your body as you bring your arms in. Try to minimize the distance your wrists move away from your chest.
In step 2, aim to extend your arms more directly horizontally. Pay attention to keeping your wrists closer to your body as you open your hands and relax.
For step 3, ensure your arms extend straight out to shoulder height. Try to keep your wrists from drifting too far away from your body as you relax.
In step 4, focus on a smooth, controlled outward movement. Keep your wrists from moving too far away from your body as you extend your arms.
For step 5, concentrate on keeping your wrists closer to your body. Aim for a more controlled outward movement and avoid excessive wrist extension.

exercise_summary: You're doing a great job with the arm movements! Try to keep your wrists closer to your body during the outward extension and relaxation phases. This will help make the exercise more effective.
